captions.text:
Good house Good car 
Would that mean happiness?

In Seoul to the SKY,
Would parents be happy?

Dream is gone, 
no time to breath

School, house and 
PC room is all we have

We live the same life and 
have to become number one

For us it’s like a double spy 
between dream and reality
Who made us a study machine?

It’s either the number one 
Or a failure

Adults made this frame 
and we fall into it
We think about it simply but

We stand upon 
even our closest friends
Whose fault is this what?

Adults say that this 
is the only hard time

Endure it do it later
Everybody say NO!

It’s not going to work any more 
Don’t be captured in other’s dreams

We roll (We roll) 
We roll (We roll) We roll
Everybody say NO!

It has to be now 
We've done nothing yet

We roll (We roll) 
We roll (We roll) We roll
Everybody say NO!

Good house Good car 
Would that mean happiness?

In Seoul to the SKY,
Would parents be happy?

I want to eat and have fun 
Torn away my uniform

Make money good money 
It’s already crooked eye

My bankbook is 
nothing but vagueness
My sadness is exceeding of limit

A studying sigh factory 
Keep on changing cards
Adults say this life is easy

They say I’m way to happy
Then why am I so unfortunate

There’s no topic 
other than studying

There are so many other 
kids like me out there

Life like puppet 
Who takes care of me?

Adults say that this is the only hard time 
Endure it do it later
Everybody say NO!

It’s not going to work any more 
Don’t be captured in other’s dreams

We roll (We roll) 
We roll (We roll) We roll
Everybody say NO!

It has to be now 
We've done nothing yet

We roll (We roll) 
We roll (We roll) We roll
Everybody say NO!

Everybody say NO! 
Everybody say NO!
Everybody say NO!
Everybody say NO!

comments.author: Chloé Berthet

comments.text:
I'm so stuck in three futures 
1. My entire family wants me to be a teacher for special kids like autism 
and down syndrome since I have a lot of patience and like little kids 
2. My best friend and I love animals and she wants me to go around the 
world studying different animals with her
3. I love to dance and sing hip hop and wanted to audition for a "certain" 
record label at the beginning of high school and I'm really good at it
I don't know what to do or how to tell my friend and family bug I know they 
are going to push me to be what they want me to be since I'm a straight A 
student and the best and most respectful﻿
comments.author: Katie Gardner

comments.text:
Watching their old MVs for celebrate #BTS1stWIN

I really don't understand why N.O is not one most popular BTS's song, this 
was the first time I'm get emotional with their music. I'm the mommy little 
girl and I love so much my parents, so I want make them proud of me, but 
what I want do in my life (draw) is not what them think is the best future 
career, but is what make me happy, so is hard everytime my mom or my dad 
say "It's useless" or "You need to find something better to do"

N.O make me understand what is important, I love my parents, but my dreams 
are what define me, is me﻿

comments.text:
the lyrics are really good and show how pressured young peoples lives are 
especially for kids in korea they are always forced to study and are 
brought up to believe that if they don't go to one of the top universities 
then they will go nowhere in life. I like to listen to this song because it 
reminds me of how lucky I am to be able to have freedom and have fun 
instead of studying all day.﻿

comments.author: Amanda Mathias

comments.text:
This songs lyrics is really unappreciated. My dad used to get kinda mad at 
my brother when He came home with a bad test and he has made me worry about 
doing well at school. Living up to someone elses dream, as to me is to do 
well at school, is something people dont want to but can get forced into 
doing. Its really sad how everyones society today has this as a perfectly 
normal case and that no one does anything with it, which is really hard to 
do i know, is kinda sad. Teenagers and college students are under more 
stress and pressure (bc of what their parents want) than a person in a 
mental hospital 50 years ago. ﻿
